articles.headline: A Student Loan System Stacked Against the Borrower
articles.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is turning its attention to student loans; one problem is that borrowers are not advised of all their options.
articles.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is turning its attention to student loans; one problem is that borrowers are not advised of all their options.
articles.lead_paragraph: “It feels like I’m being set up to fail.”

articles.headline: New Worry for Home Buyers: A Party House Next Door
articles.snippet: The proliferation of short-term rentals offered by Airbnb, HomeAway and other websites has created problems in some good-time destinations like Austin, Tex.
articles.abstract: The proliferation of short-term rentals offered by Airbnb, HomeAway and other websites has created problems in some good-time destinations like Austin, Tex.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, TEX. — The houses are often among the nicest on the block, or at least the biggest. They may be new construction where a smaller structure once stood, or an extensively renovated home with cheery paint in shades of yellow or blue.

articles.headline: Beyond VW Scandal: Home Appliance Industry No Stranger to Tricks
articles.snippet: VW’s cheating scandal is a reminder that manufacturers of appliances and electronics have gone down a similar path before, only to have standards tightened.
articles.abstract: VW’s cheating scandal is a reminder that manufacturers of appliances and electronics have gone down a similar path before, only to have standards tightened.
articles.lead_paragraph: The emissions scandal at Volkswagen was the latest instance in the auto industry’s long history of skirting safety or environmental rules, with regulators now vowing to establish more stringent tests.

articles.headline: Big Tobacco’s Staunch Friend in Washington: U.S. Chamber of Commerce
articles.snippet: Since taking over the United States Chamber of Commerce in 1997, Thomas Donohue has transformed the organization into a powerful ally of tobacco.
articles.abstract: Since taking over the United States Chamber of Commerce in 1997, Thomas Donohue has transformed the organization into a powerful ally of tobacco.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — When the Irish prime minister visited the U.S. Chamber of Commerce last year, he had a message to deliver. Ireland’s economy was recovering and his country was still open for business. “Call me anytime,” he told business leaders.

articles.headline: As British Solar Industry Loses Subsidies, Big U.S. Backer Pulls Back
articles.snippet: SunEdison, an American company, said it would end a free installation program in Britain as the government plans to slash subsidies by up to 87 percent.
articles.abstract: SunEdison, an American company, said it would end a free installation program in Britain as the government plans to slash subsidies by up to 87 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — For most of this year, SunEdison, an American company, had been pressing ahead as one of the most ambitious players in Britain’s solar energy boomlet.

articles.headline: A Biden Run Would Expose Foreign Policy Differences With Hillary Clinton
articles.snippet: The vice president candidacy would put on a public stage the foreign policy struggles he and Mrs. Clinton faced while in the Obama White House.
articles.abstract: The vice president candidacy would put on a public stage the foreign policy struggles he and Mrs. Clinton faced while in the Obama White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — She showed up with color-coded maps. He wrote long private memos. She argued for sending more troops to fight the enemy and help rebuild a country. He argued for a more targeted mission, a smaller deployment and a limit on how long they would stay.

articles.headline: Twitter Expected to Begin Layoffs and Stop Headquarters Expansion
articles.snippet: Just days after being named permanent chief of Twitter, Jack Dorsey is said to be trimming an organization that many insiders believe has grown bloated.
articles.abstract: Just days after being named permanent chief of Twitter, Jack Dorsey is said to be trimming an organization that many insiders believe has grown bloated.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jack Dorsey is tightening Twitter’s belt.

articles.headline: Desperate G.O.P. Appeals to Ryan on Speaker’s Job
articles.snippet: Republican leaders increased their efforts to persuade Rep. Paul Ryan of Wisconsin to run for speaker of the House, as they saw him as the only one with the potential to unify the party.
articles.abstract: Republican leaders increased their efforts to persuade Rep. Paul Ryan of Wisconsin to run for speaker of the House, as they saw him as the only one with the potential to unify the party.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mitt Romney called him. Speaker John A. Boehner pleaded with him. Representative Fred Upton said, “He needs to do this for the team, that’s what we are all telling him.”
articles.byline: By David M. Herszenhorn and Carl Hulse

articles.headline: Explosions During Peace Rally in Ankara, Turkey’s Capital, Kill Scores
articles.snippet: Turkish authorities were investigating claims that the attacks, which also wounded 246, were the work of suicide bombers.
articles.abstract: Turkish authorities were investigating claims that the attacks, which also wounded 246, were the work of suicide bombers.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Two devastating explosions struck Saturday morning in the heart of Ankara, the Turkish capital, killing at least 95 people who had gathered for a peace rally and heightening tensions just three weeks before snap parliamentary elections.
articles.byline: By Ceylan Yeginsu and Tim Arango

articles.headline: Flat Wages Add to Allure of the ‘Anti-Politician’ in Reliably Red States
articles.snippet: The economy in general and stagnant wages in particular have some Republican voters looking for a leader who is not entrenched in American politics.
articles.abstract: The economy in general and stagnant wages in particular have some Republican voters looking for a leader who is not entrenched in American politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ken Ard, South Carolina’s former lieutenant governor, has an accent that is the audio equivalent of a chummy slap on the back. Everything he says sounds folksy and congenial. This is true even when he is berating Washington’s political establishment, which he does often these days as the host of a morning show on Live 95.3, a talk-radio station in Florence, S.C.

articles.headline: Spying Case Against U.S. Envoy Is Falling Apart, and Following a Pattern
articles.snippet: The home and office of Robin L. Raphel were raided last year in search of evidence that she was spying for Pakistan. But that case and others have collapsed.
articles.abstract: The home and office of Robin L. Raphel were raided last year in search of evidence that she was spying for Pakistan. But that case and others have collapsed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Last fall, federal agents raided the home and office of Robin L. Raphel in search of proof that she, a seasoned member of America’s diplomatic corps, was spying for Pakistan. But officials now say the spying investigation has all but fizzled, leaving the Justice Department to decide whether to prosecute Ms. Raphel for the far less serious charge of keeping classified information in her home.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo, Mark Mazzetti and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Oregon Killings Amplify Crusade of Virginia Tech Victim’s Father
articles.snippet: Peter Read, whose daughter died in the 2007 campus massacre, stands up to gun rights supporters with a push for tougher gun safety laws.
articles.abstract: Peter Read, whose daughter died in the 2007 campus massacre, stands up to gun rights supporters with a push for tougher gun safety laws.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANNANDALE, Va. — Two days after yet another gunman opened fire on yet another college campus, Peter Read, a retired Air Force lieutenant colonel, was eating lunch on a paper plate in a gray cinder-block church basement here before two of his sons, Brendan, 11, and Patrick, 12, received Boy Scout badges and honors.

articles.headline: Shiites in Iraq Hailing Putin for Syria Push
articles.snippet: With the American-led campaign against the Islamic State stalemated, Iraqi Shiites are applauding Russia’s display of military power in neighboring Syria and the leadership of President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.abstract: With the American-led campaign against the Islamic State stalemated, Iraqi Shiites are applauding Russia’s display of military power in neighboring Syria and the leadership of President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAJAF, Iraq — One of the most popular Facebook posts in Iraq’s Shiite heartland is a Photoshopped image of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia dressed in the robe of a southern tribal sheikh.

articles.headline: Science Consultant Pushes Back Against Unlikely Opponents
articles.snippet: ChemRisk is locked in a legal fight with two activists who published an unpaid article in The Huffington Post about the company’s work related to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.
articles.abstract: ChemRisk is locked in a legal fight with two activists who published an unpaid article in The Huffington Post about the company’s work related to the Deepwater Horizon oil spill.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dr. Dennis Paustenbach, the head of the scientific consulting firm ChemRisk, has long been a leading expert for companies under legal fire for environmental practices or product safety. He and his firm have also drawn the scrutiny of investigative journalists.

articles.headline: Bankers Grapple With How to Help Emerging Markets
articles.snippet: At the root of the debate has been whether the Fed’s decision to hold interest rates near zero has increased investor confidence in the markets or hurt it.
articles.abstract: At the root of the debate has been whether the Fed’s decision to hold interest rates near zero has increased investor confidence in the markets or hurt it.
articles.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru — After a week of discussions here, bankers and policy makers agreed that stemming the rush of investments from emerging markets was one of the most important challenges facing the global economy. But there was little agreement on how to actually do that.

articles.headline: In ‘Spotlight,’ an Oscar Favorite, Dogged and Ink-Stained Heroes
articles.snippet: The forthcoming film makes heroes of the team of Boston Globe journalists who won the Pulitzer Prize in 2003 for exposing the sexual abuse of children by Catholic priests.
articles.abstract: The forthcoming film makes heroes of the team of Boston Globe journalists who won the Pulitzer Prize in 2003 for exposing the sexual abuse of children by Catholic priests.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — They have been whipsawed by the web and left jobless by the thousands in round after round of layoffs and early retirements.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Disney Reboots ‘Star Wars’ Video Games
articles.snippet: As anticipation has mounted for the restart of the “Star Wars” movie series, Disney has also overhauled how “Star Wars” video games are made.
articles.abstract: As anticipation has mounted for the restart of the “Star Wars” movie series, Disney has also overhauled how “Star Wars” video games are made.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Never mind the movie. The first big test of the unearthly riches that Disney hopes to mine from “Star Wars” is a video game.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: A Likely Debate Highlight: Democrats’ Distance From Obama
articles.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders, the major candidates for president, have already promised different approaches.
articles.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders, the major candidates for president, have already promised different approaches.
articles.lead_paragraph: The major Democratic presidential candidates disagree with President Obama on trade. They think he has not done enough to push for gun control or to overhaul the immigration system. They believe they could do a better job moving legislation through a Republican-controlled Congress.

articles.headline: Clinton Emails Became the New Focus of Benghazi Inquiry
articles.snippet: Interviews and documents show that the focus of a House committee’s work has shifted from the deadly 2012 attack in Libya to Hillary Rodham Clinton’s use of a private email server.
articles.abstract: Interviews and documents show that the focus of a House committee’s work has shifted from the deadly 2012 attack in Libya to Hillary Rodham Clinton’s use of a private email server.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the House select committee investigating the 2012 attacks on American government outposts in Benghazi, Libya, was created, Democrats immediately criticized it as a partisan effort to damage the political fortunes of Hillary Rodham Clinton.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton, Noam Scheiber and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Insurance Dropouts Present a Challenge for Health Law
articles.snippet: Mississippi, which has some of the highest rates of attrition from the insurance marketplace this year, is symbolic of the challenge facing the exchanges: keeping the customers they have.
articles.abstract: Mississippi, which has some of the highest rates of attrition from the insurance marketplace this year, is symbolic of the challenge facing the exchanges: keeping the customers they have.
articles.lead_paragraph: YAZOO CITY, Miss. — Stephanie Douglas signed up for health insurance in January with the best intentions. She had suffered a stroke and needed help paying for her medicines and care. The plan she chose from the federal insurance exchange sounded affordable — $58.17 a month after the subsidy she received under the Affordable Care Act.

articles.headline: In Takeover of EMC, Dell Makes Ambitious Bet
articles.snippet: In buying EMC, Dell is betting that the huge acquisition will help one of the best-known names in computing keep up with its rapidly evolving industry.
articles.abstract: In buying EMC, Dell is betting that the huge acquisition will help one of the best-known names in computing keep up with its rapidly evolving industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Two years ago, Michael S. Dell succeeded in taking the company that bears his name private, giving him time and flexibility to adapt it to a rapidly changing technology industry.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Nobel in Economics Given to Angus Deaton for Studies of Consumption
articles.snippet: He is best known for his insight that economic averages such as measures of national income could be misleading, because they concealed important variations.
articles.abstract: He is best known for his insight that economic averages such as measures of national income could be misleading, because they concealed important variations.
articles.lead_paragraph: The economist Angus Deaton has devoted his career to improving the data that shape public policy, including measures of wealth and poverty, savings and consumption, health and happiness.

articles.headline: Dell to Buy EMC in Biggest Tech Takeover, a Year in the Making
articles.snippet: The acquisition of the storage provider for $67 billion is intended to help Dell adapt to a changing tech landscape.
articles.abstract: The acquisition of the storage provider for $67 billion is intended to help Dell adapt to a changing tech landscape.
articles.lead_paragraph: Boston was all but frozen on Feb. 4, as the city grappled with another day locked in winter’s grip.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: U.S. Weaponry Is Turning Syria Into Proxy War With Russia
articles.snippet: Rebel commanders say that since Russian airstrikes began, antitank missiles are being readily delivered for the first time, raising morale but making a diplomatic settlement even more unlikely.
articles.abstract: Rebel commanders say that since Russian airstrikes began, antitank missiles are being readily delivered for the first time, raising morale but making a diplomatic settlement even more unlikely.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Insurgent commanders say that since Russia began air attacks in support of the Syrian government, they are receiving for the first time bountiful supplies of powerful American-made antitank missiles.
articles.byline: By Anne Barnard and Karam Shoumali

articles.headline: Deadly Ankara Attack Not Enough to Unify a Polarized Turkey
articles.snippet: Even in the face of a bombing that killed nearly 100 people, political leaders bickered among themselves rather than offer consolation.
articles.abstract: Even in the face of a bombing that killed nearly 100 people, political leaders bickered among themselves rather than offer consolation.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — After the deadliest terrorist attack in modern Turkish history, world leaders, including the pope, President Obama, Queen Elizabeth II and others, offered condolences to a grieving nation.
